activity: EL AGUA (water) - Feminine but uses 'el'. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun AGUA (water). It's feminine but uses 'el' in singular (el agua fría) to avoid 'la a-' sound. Plural: las aguas. Test me with: 1) Article agreement, 2) Adjective agreement, 3) Fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL TIEMPO (time/weather) - Masculine noun. Practice meanings and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun TIEMPO (time/weather). Masculine: el tiempo, los tiempos. Two meanings: time and weather. Test me with sentences using both meanings, article agreement, and fill-in exercises. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA CASA (house) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun CASA (house/home). Feminine: la casa, las casas. Common phrases: en casa (at home), a casa (home, direction). Test me with article agreement, adjective agreement, and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL HOMBRE (man) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun HOMBRE (man). Masculine: el hombre, los hombres. Test me with article agreement, adjective agreement, and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA MUJER (woman/wife) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun MUJER (woman/wife). Feminine: la mujer, las mujeres. Two meanings: woman and wife. Test me with sentences using both meanings, article agreement, and fill-in exercises. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA VIDA (life) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun VIDA (life). Feminine: la vida, las vidas. Common expressions: toda la vida (all my life), dar vida (give life). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL DÍA (day) - Masculine despite -a ending. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun DÍA (day). Masculine despite ending in -a: el día, los días. Common: buenos días, todo el día, un día. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA MANO (hand) - Feminine despite -o ending. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun MANO (hand). Feminine despite ending in -o: la mano, las manos. Common: dar la mano (shake hands), a mano (by hand). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL MUNDO (world) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun MUNDO (world). Masculine: el mundo, los mundos. Common: todo el mundo (everyone/the whole world). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL AÑO (year) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun AÑO (year). Masculine: el año, los años. Common: el año pasado (last year), tener X años (to be X years old). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA VEZ (time/occasion) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun VEZ (time/occasion). Feminine: la vez, las veces (note: z→c). Common: a veces (sometimes), otra vez (again), una vez (once). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA PARTE (part) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun PARTE (part). Feminine: la parte, las partes. Common: por otra parte (on the other hand), en alguna parte (somewhere). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA COSA (thing) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun COSA (thing). Feminine: la cosa, las cosas. Common: alguna cosa (something), otra cosa (something else). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun LUGAR (place). Masculine: el lugar, los lugares. Common: en primer lugar (firstly), tener lugar (take place). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL MOMENTO (moment) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.

activity: EL CABALLO (horse) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun CABALLO (horse). Masculine: el caballo, los caballos. Feminine: la yegua (mare). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA VACA (cow) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun VACA (cow). Feminine: la vaca, las vacas. Masculine: el toro (bull). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL ÁRBOL (tree) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun ÁRBOL (tree). Masculine: el árbol, los árboles. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA FLOR (flower) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun FLOR (flower). Feminine: la flor, las flores. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL SOL (sun) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun SOL (sun). Masculine: el sol (usually singular). Common: hace sol (it's sunny), tomar el sol. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA LUNA (moon) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun LUNA (moon). Feminine: la luna, las lunas. Common: luna llena (full moon). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL CIELO (sky/heaven) - Masculine noun. Practice meanings.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun CIELO (sky/heaven). Masculine: el cielo, los cielos. Two meanings: sky and heaven. Also term of endearment. Test me with sentences using different meanings. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA TIERRA (earth/land) - Feminine noun. Practice meanings.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun TIERRA (earth/land/ground). Feminine: la tierra, las tierras. Meanings: Earth (planet), land, soil. Test me with sentences using different meanings. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL MAR (sea) - Usually masculine. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun MAR (sea). Usually masculine: el mar, los mares. Can be feminine in poetic/nautical usage (la mar). Common: en el mar. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL RÍO (river) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun RÍO (river). Masculine: el río, los ríos. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA MONTAÑA (mountain) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun MONTAÑA (mountain). Feminine: la montaña, las montañas. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA PLAYA (beach) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun PLAYA (beach). Feminine: la playa, las playas. Common: ir a la playa. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA LLUVIA (rain) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun LLUVIA (rain). Feminine: la lluvia, las lluvias. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA NIEVE (snow) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun NIEVE (snow). Feminine: la nieve (usually singular). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL VIENTO (wind) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun VIENTO (wind). Masculine: el viento, los vientos. Common: hace viento (it's windy). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL FUEGO (fire) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun FUEGO (fire). Masculine: el fuego, los fuegos. Common: fuegos artificiales (fireworks). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL AIRE (air) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun AIRE (air). Masculine: el aire (usually singular). Common: al aire libre (outdoors), aire acondicionado. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA LUZ (light) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun LUZ (light). Feminine: la luz, las luces (note: z→c). Common: encender/apagar la luz. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL COLOR (color) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun COLOR (color). Masculine: el color, los colores. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL NÚMERO (number) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun NÚMERO (number). Masculine: el número, los números. Common: número de teléfono. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA LETRA (letter) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun LETRA (letter - alphabet/lyrics). Feminine: la letra, las letras. Two meanings: letter of alphabet and song lyrics. Test me with sentences using both meanings. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL NOMBRE (name) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun NOMBRE (name). Masculine: el nombre, los nombres. Common: nombre de pila (first name), en nombre de. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL APELLIDO (surname) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun APELLIDO (surname). Masculine: el apellido, los apellidos. Note: Spanish people typically have two surnames. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA DIRECCIÓN (address/direction) - Feminine noun. Practice meanings.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun DIRECCIÓN (address/direction). Feminine: la dirección, las direcciones. Two meanings: postal address and direction/management. Test me with sentences using both meanings. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL TELÉFONO (telephone) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun TELÉFONO (telephone). Masculine: el teléfono, los teléfonos. Common: llamar por teléfono, teléfono móvil. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL ORDENADOR (computer - Spain) - Masculine noun. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun ORDENADOR (computer - Spain). Masculine: el ordenador, los ordenadores. Note: Latin America uses 'la computadora'. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL/LA INTERNET (internet) - Ambiguous gender. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun INTERNET. Can be masculine (el internet) or feminine (la internet). Both are correct. Common: en internet. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL CORREO (mail/email) - Masculine noun. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun CORREO (mail/email). Masculine: el correo, los correos. Common: correo electrónico (email), oficina de correos. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL MENSAJE (message) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun MENSAJE (message). Masculine: el mensaje, los mensajes. Common: dejar un mensaje, mensaje de texto. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA NOTICIA (news item) - Feminine noun. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun NOTICIA (news item). Feminine: la noticia, las noticias. Note: 'las noticias' = the news. Common: buenas/malas noticias. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL PERIÓDICO (newspaper) - Masculine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun PERIÓDICO (newspaper). Masculine: el periódico, los periódicos. Common: leer el periódico. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA REVISTA (magazine) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun REVISTA (magazine). Feminine: la revista, las revistas. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA PELÍCULA (film) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun PELÍCULA (film/movie). Feminine: la película, las películas. Common: ver una película. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA CANCIÓN (song) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun CANCIÓN (song). Feminine: la canción, las canciones. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA MÚSICA (music) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun MÚSICA (music). Feminine: la música (usually singular). Common: escuchar música. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL ARTE (art) - Masculine singular, feminine plural.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun ARTE (art). Masculine in singular: el arte. Feminine in plural: las artes (las bellas artes). Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun DEPORTE (sport). Masculine: el deporte, los deportes. Common: hacer deporte, deportes de invierno. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL PARTIDO (match/party) - Masculine noun. Practice meanings.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun PARTIDO (match/political party). Masculine: el partido, los partidos. Two meanings: sports match and political party. Test me with sentences using both meanings. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA FIESTA (party/holiday) - Feminine noun. Practice meanings.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun FIESTA (party/holiday). Feminine: la fiesta, las fiestas. Two meanings: celebration/party and public holiday. Test me with sentences using both meanings. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LAS VACACIONES (vacation) - Feminine plural. Practice usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun VACACIONES (vacation). Always plural: las vacaciones. Common: ir de vacaciones, vacaciones de verano. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun RESTAURANTE (restaurant). Masculine: el restaurante, los restaurantes. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun HOSPITAL (hospital). Masculine: el hospital, los hospitales. Common: ir al hospital, estar en el hospital. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: EL/LA ESTUDIANTE (student) - Same form, different article.

activity: EL ABOGADO / LA ABOGADA (lawyer) - Practice both genders.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun ABOGADO/ABOGADA (lawyer). Masculine: el abogado, los abogados. Feminine: la abogada, las abogadas. Test me with gendered article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

activity: LA EMPRESA (company) - Feminine noun. Practice gender and usage.
prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun EMPRESA (company/business). Feminine: la empresa, las empresas. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun OFICINA (office). Feminine: la oficina, las oficinas. Common: ir a la oficina. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun ZAPATO (shoe). Masculine: el zapato, los zapatos. Common: par de zapatos. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun CHAQUETA (jacket). Feminine: la chaqueta, las chaquetas. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun SOMBRERO (hat). Masculine: el sombrero, los sombreros. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.

prompt: Quiz me on the Spanish noun GAFAS (glasses). Always plural: las gafas. Common: gafas de sol (sunglasses), llevar gafas. Test me with article agreement and fill-in sentences. Use Castilian Spanish.
